Have you ever heard of the fresh start effect? It's when we're more likely to take action toward a goal after a special event or date has passed. Examples include New Year's Day, the first day of the month, or even a Monday. These can act as mental triggers for us to start something new. 👉 I learned about a strategy to create even more chances for fresh starts - dividing the day into smaller segments like 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗼𝗼𝗻, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴. This way, if you miss an opportunity to do something, you can try again in a few hours. For example, if you have a tough morning, don't let it ruin the whole day - you can start fresh in the afternoon.🧩

Correction: In a previous version of this post, I incorrectly stated that the terms 'bull' and 'bear' in relation to the stock market originated from the movements of the animals themselves (i.e. bulls attack by swiping up, bears by swiping down). This is not the case. The terms originated from a proverb warning against selling the bear's skin before you have caught it. The term 'bear' was first used in the 18th century to refer to speculators selling stock they didn't own, expecting prices to drop. This practice was prevalent in the South Sea bubble scandal of 1720, which brought the term into widespread use. The term 'bull' was later coined to refer to those who bought securities or commodities expecting a price rise. The more you know.🧩#MarketsClick [+ Follow] for more

Growing and thriving are similar in that they both refer to the development of new abilities, the expansion of existing ones or some form of progress. However:A growing plant is getting bigger and developing new leaves and branches. Likewise, a 𝗴𝗿𝗼𝘄𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻 is developing new skills and experiences that help them become more capable and knowledgeable.Instead, a thriving plant is not just getting bigger but is also healthy and producing flowers or fruit. Likewise, a 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 is not just developing new skills but is also happy and successful.👉 In summary, growth refers to progress, expansion and development of new skills. Thriving, on the other hand, implies that something is not just growing but is also healthy and prosperous. As we consider the future of our career, company, or family, it is helpful to ask ourselves whether we are simply growing or if we are truly thriving. 🧩

Last week the world population reached 8 Billion people! Growing up, I heard about the dangers of endless overpopulation.Instead, we'll peak at about 10.4 billion in 2086 before falling again.Here's how quickly the population grew:• It was in 1805 that the world reached its first billion; it then took another 120 years to reach two billion. • By the third billion, this period had reduced to 35 years, reduced further to 14 years to reach four billion. • The fastest growth occurred from 1974 to 2011, taking only 12 to 13 years to increase by one billion for the 5th, 6th, and 7th.• The world has now surpassed the peak growth rate, and the period between each billion will continue to rise. • It's estimated to take approximately 14 years to reach nine billion in 2037 and a further 21 years to reach 10 billion in 2058. 🧩
